original: Claeson, Bo Nils, praktiserande läkare, Hailmstad, f. 21/9/01 i Gbg av grosshandl. Herman C. o. Olga Johanna Brundin. G. 30 m.. Greta Kristina Bäcklin. Barn: Anna Märta f. 32, Ulla 36. — Stud:ex. i Gbg 20, med. kand. i Upps. 25 o. med. lic. där 30. E. läk. v. Söderköp. brunn 29, v. Strängnäs hosp. 30, e. o. hosp :läk. av 2. kl. v. Källsihagens sjukh. 30-31, assist :iäk. v. Sahlgr. sjukh. kir. avd. samt tf. und:läk. v. Löts sanat. 31, assist :läk. v. Karlstads las. med. avd. 31-32, und:läk. v. Arvika sanat. 32- 33, prakt. läk. i Halmstad samt läk. v. S:t Olofshemmet där sed. 33. Bat:-läk. v. L 16 sed. 45.
translated: Claeson, Bo Nils, practicing physician, Hailmstad, born September 21, 1901 in Gothenburg to merchant Herman C. and Olga Johanna Brundin. Married since 1930 to Greta Kristina Bäcklin. Children: Anna Märta born in 1932 and Ulla born in 1936. Bo Nils Claeson completed his high school education in Gothenburg in 1920, received his Bachelor of Medicine in Uppsala in 1925, and his medical license there in 1930. He worked as a resident physician at Söderköping's spa in 1929, at Strängnäs hospital in 1930, and as an assistant physician at the second-class Källsihagen Hospital from 1930-1931. He then worked as an assisting physician at Sahlgrensjukhuset's surgical department and as acting assistant physician at Löts sanatorium in 1931. In 1931-1932, he worked as an assistant physician at Karlstads lasarett's medical department, and as a junior physician at Arvika sanatorium from 1932-1933. Bo Nils Claeson has been a practicing physician in Halmstad and also worked as a physician at St. Olaf's Home since 1933. He also served as a battalion physician at L16 since 1945.
